page.title: 04CREE BRIDGE,NEWTON STEWART
page.content: The Cree Bridge,the only road bridge in Newton Stewart,is situated in the middle of the town. Newton Stewart and the{Cree Bridge were possibly built where they were because it was the nearest point from the sea at which the{River Cree}could be forded. As it was a dangerous river to cross in the winter townsfolk got together and built a flimsy wooden bridge which lasted for sixty_one years until it was washed away by a flood in 1806. The granite bridge was designed by {John Rennie(1761-1821)}who also designed the original Waterloo,London and Southwark bridges.Work began in 1813.John Rennie was famous for his bridge_designing and was offered a knighthood,but refused. The Cree Bridge links Newton Stewart with the small village of{Minnigaff.
